title: Can I enlist in the U.S. Military if I owe court fines in another state?
question: If not, is it possible to pay them off while going through training?
answers: Depending on the reason you have court fines, you may not be eligible to enlist at all. See your recruiter.

Every case is different. Military recruiters evaluate potential recruits, and waivers are allocated, based on the underlying misconduct charged versus the actual outcome of the case. Unfortunately, in a lot of cases whether or not you are able to enlist may depend on how much effort the recruiter is willing to put forth. Your situation does not appear to be overly complicated. Additional information is available on my website. I would be happy to discuss your options with you. The initial consult is always free. Good luck.
Yes, you should pay them off during trsining. Ultimately failure to pay debts can be grounds for admin discharge.
I think it depends on the charge and fine, but often charges need to e resolved.
The real question is why do you owe court fines? The answer to that question may determine whether your eligible to enlist at all. Recommend you talk to a recruiter.
